ReferencesAndLinks: Ceponiene R., Westerfield M., Torki M., ; Townsend J., "Modality-specificity of sensory aging in vision and audition: Evidence from event-related potentials," Brain Research, 2008, vol. 1215, Pgs 53-68. DOI: 10.1016/j.brainres.2008.02.010 Westerfield M., Schroeder S., Lee K., Adamo M., Ceponiene R., Townsend J.; Cross- modal shifting attention in healthy aging: an ERP study. Program No. 933.9. 2003 Abstract Viewer/Itinerary Planner. Washington, DC: Society for Neuroscience SfN_AVshift_P3.pdf
dataset_description.json.Name: Auditory-Visual Shift Study

README: The purpose behind conducting the Auditory-Visual Shift study is to explore the effects of aging on the processing of sensory auditory and visual stimuli. The study is comprised of data collected from 38 healthy adult subjects covering both young adults and elderly adults. For each subject, the experiment begins with one Focus Auditory (FA) block and one Focus Visual (FV) block, followed by 12 Shift (SH) blocks and another 3 FA and FV blocks each, where the order of the FA and FV sequences was randomized across subjects. In the Shift condition, subjects must shift their attention between the visual modality and the auditory modality based on the presentation of 'Look' and 'Hear' cues. In the Focus condition, subjects are told prior to the start of the block which modality (auditory or visual) to attend to. The stimuli is presented in blocks of 264 for duration of 2.64 min. The auditory stimuli are 100-ms 550-Hz (target) and 500-Hz (non-target) sine-wave tones, amplitude-modulated at 5 Hz. The visual stimuli are light-blue (target) and a dark-blue (non-target) 8.4 cm2 filled squares presented on a computer monitor. Altogether, 384 unattended non-target stimuli per modality were presented during the Focus condition and 576 non-target stimuli were presented during the Shift condition.

sub-001_task-AuditoryVisualShift_run-01_.InstitutionAddress: 9500 Gilman Dr, Dept 0523, La Jolla, CA 92093, USA
sub-001_task-AuditoryVisualShift_run-01_.Instructions: In the Shift condition, not reported in this paper, the subjects shifted their attention following the cue. In the Focus condition, reported in this paper, subjects ignored the cues and attended to the same modality during the whole block. The modality to attend was indicated prior to each block. The subjects' task was to press a button upon a detection of a relevant-modality target. At all times, subjects had to fixate on a cross continuously presented in the middle of the computer monitor. They were visually monitored to ensure proper fixation.
sub-001_task-AuditoryVisualShift_run-01_.EEGReference: average of the left- and right-mastoid

FilterDescription.Description: .01 Hz and 60 Hz (high- and low-pass, respectively)

duration.Description: Duration of the event (measured from onset) in seconds

Levels.1: Focus Auditory Block. Subjects ignore the 'Look' cues and attend only to the 'Hear' cues during the whole block
Levels.2: Focus Visual Block. Subjects ignore the 'Hear' cues and attend only to the 'Look' cues during the whole block
Levels.3: Shift Block. Subjects shifted their attention following the cue during the whole block

value.Description: Marker value associated with the event

Levels.11: Focus Auditory Block. A 200-ms word 'Hear' that instructs subjects to attend to the auditory modality is presented. Cue is attended to in this block.
Levels.12: Focus Auditory Block. A 200-ms word 'Look' that instructs subjects to attend to the visual modality is presented. Cue is ignored in this block.
Levels.1201: Focus Auditory Block. Button press. The subject presses a button in response to detecting the target in the specific modality he or she is attending to.
Levels.2201: Focus Visual Block. Button press. The subject presses a button in response to detecting the target in the specific modality he or she is attending to.
Levels.3201: Shift Condition Block. Button press. The subject presses a button in response to detecting the target in the specific modality he or she is attending to.
Levels.314: Shift Condition Block. During the Shift Condition Block, subject ignores to the dark blue 8.4 cm2 filled square since cue was HEAR.
Levels.313: Shift Condition Block. Shift Condition BlockDuring the Shift Condition Block, subject ignores to the 100-ms 500-Hz sine wave tone played since cue was LOOK.
Levels.312: Shift Condition Block. During the Shift Condition Block, subject attends to the dark blue 8.4 cm2 filled square since cue was LOOK.
Levels.311: Shift Condition Block. During the Shift Condition Block, subject attends to the 100-ms 500-Hz sine wave tone played since cue was HEAR.
Levels.310: Shift Condition Block. During the Shift Condition Block, subject ignores to the light blue 8.4 cm2 filled square since cue was HEAR.
Levels.39: Shift Condition Block. During the Shift Condition Block, subject ignores to the 100-ms 550-Hz sine wave tone played since cue was LOOK.

onset.Description: Onset of the event measured from the beginning of the acquisition of the first volume in the corresponding task imaging data file

HED.Description: Tags describing the nature of the event

sample.Description: Onset of the event according to the sampling scheme of the recorded modality

sub-028_task-AuditoryVisualShift_run-01_.TaskDescription: For each subject, the experiment begins with one Focus Auditory (FA) block and one Focus Visual (FV) block, followed by 12 Shift (SH) blocks and another 3 FA and FV blocks each, where the order of the FA and FV sequences was randomized across subjects. In the Shift condition, subjects must shift their attention between the visual modality and the auditory modality based on the presentation of \"Look\" and \"Hear\" cues. In the Focus condition, subjects are told prior to the start of the block which modality (auditory or visual) to attend to. The stimuli is presented in blocks of 264 for duration of 2.64 min. The auditory stimuli are 100-ms 550-Hz (target) and 500-Hz (non-target) sine-wave tones, amplitude-modulated at 5 Hz. The visual stimuli are light-blue (target) and a dark-blue (non-target) 8.4 cm2 filled squares presented on a computer monitor. Altogether, 384 unattended non-target stimuli per modality were presented during the Focus condition and 576 non-target stimuli were presented during the Shift condition.
sub-028_task-AuditoryVisualShift_run-01_.InstitutionAddress: 9500 Gilman Dr, Dept 0523, La Jolla, CA 92093, USA
sub-028_task-AuditoryVisualShift_run-01_.Instructions: In the Shift condition, not reported in this paper, the subjects shifted their attention following the cue. In the Focus condition, reported in this paper, subjects ignored the cues and attended to the same modality during the whole block. The modality to attend was indicated prior to each block. The subjects' task was to press a button upon a detection of a relevant-modality target. At all times, subjects had to fixate on a cross continuously presented in the middle of the computer monitor. They were visually monitored to ensure proper fixation.
sub-028_task-AuditoryVisualShift_run-01_.EEGReference: average of the left- and right-mastoid

FilterDescription.Description: .01 Hz and 60 Hz (high- and low-pass, respectively)

duration.Description: Duration of the event (measured from onset) in seconds

Levels.1: Focus Auditory Block. Subjects ignore the 'Look' cues and attend only to the 'Hear' cues during the whole block
Levels.2: Focus Visual Block. Subjects ignore the 'Hear' cues and attend only to the 'Look' cues during the whole block
Levels.3: Shift Block. Subjects shifted their attention following the cue during the whole block

value.Description: Marker value associated with the event

Levels.11: Focus Auditory Block. A 200-ms word 'Hear' that instructs subjects to attend to the auditory modality is presented. Cue is attended to in this block.
Levels.12: Focus Auditory Block. A 200-ms word 'Look' that instructs subjects to attend to the visual modality is presented. Cue is ignored in this block.
Levels.1201: Focus Auditory Block. Button press. The subject presses a button in response to detecting the target in the specific modality he or she is attending to.
Levels.2201: Focus Visual Block. Button press. The subject presses a button in response to detecting the target in the specific modality he or she is attending to.
Levels.3201: Shift Condition Block. Button press. The subject presses a button in response to detecting the target in the specific modality he or she is attending to.
Levels.314: Shift Condition Block. During the Shift Condition Block, subject ignores to the dark blue 8.4 cm2 filled square since cue was HEAR.
Levels.313: Shift Condition Block. Shift Condition BlockDuring the Shift Condition Block, subject ignores to the 100-ms 500-Hz sine wave tone played since cue was LOOK.
Levels.312: Shift Condition Block. During the Shift Condition Block, subject attends to the dark blue 8.4 cm2 filled square since cue was LOOK.
Levels.311: Shift Condition Block. During the Shift Condition Block, subject attends to the 100-ms 500-Hz sine wave tone played since cue was HEAR.

sub-040_task-AuditoryVisualShift_run-01_.TaskDescription: For each subject, the experiment begins with one Focus Auditory (FA) block and one Focus Visual (FV) block, followed by 12 Shift (SH) blocks and another 3 FA and FV blocks each, where the order of the FA and FV sequences was randomized across subjects. In the Shift condition, subjects must shift their attention between the visual modality and the auditory modality based on the presentation of \"Look\" and \"Hear\" cues. In the Focus condition, subjects are told prior to the start of the block which modality (auditory or visual) to attend to. The stimuli is presented in blocks of 264 for duration of 2.64 min. The auditory stimuli are 100-ms 550-Hz (target) and 500-Hz (non-target) sine-wave tones, amplitude-modulated at 5 Hz. The visual stimuli are light-blue (target) and a dark-blue (non-target) 8.4 cm2 filled squares presented on a computer monitor. Altogether, 384 unattended non-target stimuli per modality were presented during the Focus condition and 576 non-target stimuli were presented during the Shift condition.
sub-040_task-AuditoryVisualShift_run-01_.InstitutionAddress: 9500 Gilman Dr, Dept 0523, La Jolla, CA 92093, USA
sub-040_task-AuditoryVisualShift_run-01_.Instructions: In the Shift condition, not reported in this paper, the subjects shifted their attention following the cue. In the Focus condition, reported in this paper, subjects ignored the cues and attended to the same modality during the whole block. The modality to attend was indicated prior to each block. The subjects' task was to press a button upon a detection of a relevant-modality target. At all times, subjects had to fixate on a cross continuously presented in the middle of the computer monitor. They were visually monitored to ensure proper fixation.
sub-040_task-AuditoryVisualShift_run-01_.EEGReference: average of the left- and right-mastoid

FilterDescription.Description: .01 Hz and 60 Hz (high- and low-pass, respectively)
